activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael P. Heidenreich

records.addlTxt:
2:32 PM Defendant Michael P. Heidenreich in court. Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Michael P. Heidenreich. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 22CF51, 22CF89, 22CM198, 20CM221, 21CF190 & 21TR1489 - 21TR1491. 22CM198 set for an initial appearance. In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea. Schiek statement bond. Court sets bond in 22CM198 and continues bond in other cases. Court states if no resolution at next hearing will schedule for trial. adj. 02:37 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Answer to demand for discovery and inspection

records.addlTxt:
1:43 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michael P. Heidenreich in court. Attorney Breanna Halyburton appearing specially for Breanna Magallones in court for Michael P. Heidenreich. Calling 21CF190, 22CF51, 22CF89, 20CM221 & 21TR1489 - 21TR1492. 21CF190, 22CF51 & 22CF89 set for a Preliminary hearing. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Sowinski states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Halyburton willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Bond continued. adj. 01:47 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
3:13 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michael P. Heidenreich in court. Attorney Breanna Magallones appearing in court.  Calling 20CM221, 21CF190 & 22CF51, 22CF89 & 21TR1489 - 21TR1492. Magallones states will be representing. In receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing - time limits waived. Bail continued. adj. 03:14 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

3:09 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michael P. Heidenreich in court. Calling 20CM221, 21CF190, 22CF51, 22CF89, 21TR1489 - 21TR1492. Defendant states not eligible for PD - going to hire private counsel - would like to set out. Bond continued. adj. 03:11 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:41 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael P. Heidenreich in court. Calling 20CM221, 21CF190, 22CF51, 21TR1489- 21TR1492. Court review of case. Defendant statement to employment - would like to set out to to raise funds. Bond continued. adj. 02:43 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:31 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Michael P. Heidenreich appeared by video, in custody. Calling 20CM221, 21CF190, 22CF51 & 21TR1489 - 21TR1492. Court review of case. Court states Defendant not eligible for Court Appointed Counsel. Defendant states should be able to post bond in a few days. Court will set out. Bond continued. adj. 02:34 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:36 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Michael P. Heidenreich appeared by video, in custody. Calling 22CF51, 21CF190, 20CM221 & 21TR1490 - 21TR1492. Court questions Defendant on counsel on 22CF51. Defendant states not eligible for PD - would like to hire counsel - possibly get court appointed counsel - statement to bond. Pfeifer statement to bond. Court lowers cash bond in 21CF190. Defendant to appear in person at next hearing. adj. 02:41 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:17 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Michael P. Heidenreich appeared in court, in custody. Attorney Breanna Magallones appearing in court. Calling 22CF51, 20CM221, 21CF190 & 21TR1489 - 21TR1492. 21CF51 set for an initial appearance. 20CM221 & 21CF190 set for a Bail hearing. Court review of case - quashes warrants. Magallones does not know why Defendant did not appear - states she will be withdrawing - Defendant is not eligible for services. Defendant statement to non-appearance/counsel. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Schiek statement to bail. Court sets bond in 22CF51 of $500 cash, sets $10,000 in 21CF190 & reinstates bond in 20CM221. adj. 01:25 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 02:30 p
